question: What is Amazon EC2?
choices: A database service for managing relational data.
A virtual server that provides scalable computing capacity.
A tool for monitoring application performance.
A file storage service for storing and retrieving files in the cloud.

question: What is multi-tenancy?
choices: Sharing underlying hardware among multiple virtual machines (VMs)
Running multiple virtual machines on separate physical servers
Storing all users' data in a single, non-isolated database
Providing each user with a dedicated, isolated physical server

question: What is ELB?
choices: Running multiple virtual machines on separate physical servers
A service that distributes incoming traffic across multiple servers to ensure high availability and reliability
A tool used for storing data across multiple cloud storage locations
A service that provides virtual machines for running applications on the cloud

question: Which EC2 instance type is ideal for web servers and code repositories?
Which EC2 instance type is designed for tasks such as gaming, scientific computing, and high-performance computing (HPC)?
Which EC2 instance type is best for real-time data processing that requires fast access to large datasets?
Which EC2 instance type is designed for floating point calculations, graphics processing, and data pattern matching?
Which EC2 instance type is optimized for high storage throughput and capacity, such as log processing, backup, and archiving?
Which EC2 pricing model is ideal for short-term, unpredictable workloads?
Which EC2 pricing model is cost-effective for steady-state workloads and comes with long-term contracts (1 or 3 years)?
Which EC2 pricing model allows changing instance types during the term and offers long-term contracts with upfront payment?
Which EC2 pricing model is a cost-effective option for workloads that are flexible in terms of when they start and end, but come with the risk of interruption?
Which EC2 pricing model allows you to run instances on hardware dedicated to a single customer, providing isolation and compliance for sensitive workloads?

How does proximity to cloud regions affect application performance?
choices: It reduces latency and improves application performance by choosing a region close to your users
It provides more cost-effective pricing options
It guarantees the availability of all cloud features

question: What is the main reason for choosing a cloud region close to your users?
choices: To ensure better compliance with data protection regulations
To reduce latency and improve application performance
To access more advanced cloud features and services
To reduce the overall cost of cloud services

question: Which of the following is not a factor to consider in cloud services for most users?
choices: Compliance with industry standards and regulations
Proximity to users to reduce latency and improve performance
Feature Availability and service offerings to meet their application needs
Pricing to optimize costs based on workload requirements
The specific architecture of the cloud provider's data centers

question: Which of the following is a virtual hard drive for use with EC2 instances?
Which of the following is a scalable file storage service for use with AWS Cloud services and on-premises resources?
Which of the following is a scalable object storage service designed for storing and retrieving any amount of data?
Which of the following is not true for Amazon EBS?
choices: Data is stored in volumes as blocks.
Typically used for applications requiring low-latency access to data.
EBS and EC2 must reside in the same AZ.

question: Which of the following is not true for Amazon EFS?
choices: It is designed to be accessible by multiple EC2s at the same time.
It stores data in a single AZ.

question: Which of the following is not an ideal use case for Amazon S3?
Which of the following has the longest retrieval time?
Which of the following doesn't have retrieval time in milliseconds?
Which of the following is suitable for frequently accessed data?
Which of the following moves data between two access tiers (frequent and infrequent) based on changing access patterns?
Which of the following is suitable for infrequently accessed data but requires rapid retrieval/high availability?
Which of the following is suitable for infrequently accessed data that doesn't require multiple AZ resilience?
Which of the following is suitable for data archiving and long-term backup with retrieval times ranging from mins to hrs?
Which of the following is the lowest cost storage class designed for long-term data archiving?
A hybrid cloud storage service that enables on-premises applications to seamlessly use AWS cloud storage.
A feature of Amazon S3 that speeds up uploads and downloads for large files over long distances.
A service designed to minimize downtime and data loss for applications running on AWS.
A file system service that makes it easy to launch and run file systems in the cloud.
Which AWS management tool helps to reduce costs, increase performance, and improve security by providing real-time guidance?
Which of the following is NOT one of the categories AWS Trusted Advisor provides insights into?
Which AWS Trusted Advisor recommendation helps to identify underutilized resources to reduce costs?
Which AWS Trusted Advisor recommendation provides recommendations to improve the performance of AWS resources?
Which AWS Trusted Advisor recommendation suggests ways to improve the resilience of applications?
Service Limits is one of the 5 categories of AWS Trusted Advisor recommendations. Which of the followings is not an example of Service Limits?
choices: Recommending the right instance types for EC2 based on usage patterns.
Identifying S3 buckets that don’t have public access settings configured properly.
Alerting on unused Elastic Load Balancers that can be removed to save costs.
Providing insights into unused EC2 instances that can be terminated.

question: "Attain efficient workload management, derive meaningful insights, and consistently improve supporting processes." Which of the following is a pillar of the Well-Architected Framework that aligns with this definition?

"Encompasses the protection of data, systems, and assets while delivering business value. (Monitor, alert, audit actions and changes)." Which of the following is a pillar of the Well-Architected Framework that aligns with this definition?
"Consistently and accurately perform intended functions." Which of the following is a pillar of the Well-Architected Framework that aligns with this definition?

"Utilize computing resources effectively to meet system requirements. (Deploy globally in minutes)" Which of the following is a pillar of the Well-Architected Framework that aligns with this definition?

"Focuses on avoiding unnecessary costs and maximizing return on investment. (Analyze and attribute expenditures)" Which of the following is a pillar of the Well-Architected Framework that aligns with this definition?

"Optimize your workloads to minimize their environmental impact while ensuring efficient resource use and operational resilience." Which of the following is a pillar of the Well-Architected Framework that aligns with this definition?
A service that allows you to review and improve your workloads based on the best practices outlined in the Well-Architected Framework.

"Aligns cloud adoption with business goals, helping stakeholders understand benefits and ROI. (e.g. Product management)" Which of the following perspectives of the Cloud Adoption Framework best matches this definition?

"Focuses on organizational change management, training, and skill development to support cloud adoption." Which of the following perspectives of the Cloud Adoption Framework best matches this definition?

"Establishes policies, controls, and compliance frameworks to manage risk and ensure governance in the cloud. (e.g. Application portfolio management)" Which of the following perspectives of the Cloud Adoption Framework best matches this definition?

"Involves the technical aspects, such as architecture and integration, to optimize performance and security." Which of the following perspectives of the Cloud Adoption Framework best matches this definition?

"Emphasizes the importance of security best practices and compliance throughout the cloud journey. (e.g. IAM)" Which of the following perspectives of the Cloud Adoption Framework best matches this definition?

"Ensures readiness, including monitoring, incident response, and ongoing management of cloud resources. (e.g. Performance and capacity management, implementing governance frameworks, etc.)" Which of the following perspectives of the Cloud Adoption Framework best matches this definition?
"Quick migration of legacy applications to reduce on-premises infrastructure costs." Which of the following strategy of the Cloud Migration Strategies best matches this use case?
"Migrating a database to Amazon RDS while keeping the application largely intact." Which of the following strategy of the Cloud Migration Strategies best matches this use case?
"Breaking a monolithic application into microservices for improved agility and scalability." Which of the following strategy of the Cloud Migration Strategies best matches this use case?
"Switching from an on-premises CRM to a cloud-based CRM solution like Salesforce." Which of the following strategy of the Cloud Migration Strategies best matches this use case?
"Phasing out obsolete applications to streamline operations and reduce costs." Which of the following strategy of the Cloud Migration Strategies best matches this use case?
"Maintaining regulatory compliance for specific applications that cannot move to the cloud yet." Which of the following strategy of the Cloud Migration Strategies best matches this use case?
Which of the following is a responsibility of AWS?

Defining network firewalls inside the VPC

question: Which of the following is a responsibility of AWS?
choices: Defining network firewalls inside the VPC

question: Which of the following is a responsibility of AWS?
choices: Maintains the configuration of its infrastructure devices
Defining network firewalls inside the VPC
Data protection (at rest – Customer Side Encryption)

question: Which of the following is a responsibility of AWS?
choices: Data protection (at rest – Customer Side Encryption)

choices: The physical security of AWS facilities

choices: The physical security of AWS facilities
